00033 # Description: Sends an syn to broadcast address, the destination host

00037 import unittest 
00038 from pcs.packets import ipv4
00039 from pcs.packets import tcp
00040 from pcs.packets import ethernet
00041 import tcptest
00042 import pcs
00043 import pdb
00044 
00045 class TestSendSyn4BroadcastAddress(unittest.TestCase):
00046     """
00047        Sends an syn to broadcast address, the destination host 
00048        cannot answer this send 
00049     """
00050 
00051     def setUp(self):
00052         """
00053         """
00054         import random
00055         
00056         #constants
00057         self.thisside = 0
00058         self.thatside = 1
00059 
00060         self.tcb = tcptest.tcb()
00061         
00062         self.tcb.ip = { self.thisside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.210") , \
00063                     self.thatside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.220")}
00064         
00065 
00066         self.tcb.ipid = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1, (1<<16)-1) , \
00067                       self.thatside : 0}
00068 
00069 
00070         self.tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000, 60000) , \
00071                          self.thatside : 9}
00072 
00073         self.tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00074                              self.thatside : 0}
00075         
00076         
00077         self.tcb.ether = \
00078                 { self.thisside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:9d:57:c9") , \
00079                   self.thatside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:db:c5:22") }
00080 
00081 
00082         self.tcb.output = { self.thisside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") , \
00083                         self.thatside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") } 
00084         
00085         
00086         
00087 
00088     def testSendSyn4BroadcastAddress(self):
00089         #THISSIDE
00090         (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = tcptest.createsyn(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00091                               
00092         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00093                                                            
00094         
00095         
00096         #THATHSIDE
00097         #Receiving SYN (unfurtunately this time we are receiving from 
00098         #the same board)
00099         (ipsynreceived, tcpsynreceived) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thatside, self.thisside)
00100                                                                     
00101 
00102         self.assertEqual(ipsyn, ipsynreceived)
00103         self.assertEqual(tcpsyn, tcpsynreceived)
00104         print ipsynreceived 
00105         print tcpsynreceived 
00106 
00107 
00108     #
00109     #Receiving SYN+ACK
00110     #
00111         #THISSIDE
00112         #Receivinig SYN + ACK
00113         (ipsynack, tcpsynack) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00114                                
00115 
00116         #Some blackmagic to use assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK at SYN
00117         self.tcb.tcpsequence[ self.thatside ] = tcpsynack.sequence  
00118         tcptest.assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, self.tcb, tcpsynack, \
00119                     self.thisside, self.thatside)
00120 
00121         tcptest.assertSynPresent(self, tcpsynack)
00122 
00123         #OK Its a SYN+ACK --> SYN consumes a sequence
00124         self.tcb.tcpsequence[ self.thatside ] = tcpsynack.sequence + 1
00125         print tcpsynack 
00126 
00127 
00128     #
00129     #Sending ACK
00130     #
00131         #THISSIDE
00132         (ipack, tcpack) = tcptest.createip(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, \
00133                              self.thatside)
00134 
00135         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipack, tcpack, self.thisside, \
00136                                                            self.thatside)
00137         print tcpack 
00138 
00139         #THATHSIDE
00140         #Receiving SYN (unfurtunately this time we are receiving from the same board) 
00141         (ipackreceived, tcpackreceived) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thatside, self.thisside)
00142                                                                     
00143         #Different values then 0 and 1 to tcpflags TODO
00144         #self.assertEqual(ipack, ipackreceived)
00145         #self.assertEqual(tcpack, tcpackreceived)
00146 
00147 
00148     #
00149     #Sending FIN
00150     #
00151         #THISSIDE
00152         (ipfin, tcpfin) = tcptest.createfin(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00153         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipfin, tcpfin, self.thisside, \
00154                                                            self.thatside)
00155         print tcpfin 
00156 
00157         #THATHSIDE
00158         #Receiving SYN (unfurtunately this time we are receiving from the same board) 
00159         (ipfinreceived, tcpfinreceived) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thatside, \
00160                                                                     self.thisside)
00161         #Different values then 0 and 1 to tcpflags TODO
00162         #self.assertEqual(ipfin, ipfinreceived)
00163         #self.assertEqual(tcpfin, tcpfinreceived)
00164         
00165     #
00166     #Receiving ACK from FIN sent
00167     #
00168  #      pdb.set_trace()       
00169 
00170         #THISSIDE
00171         #Receiving ACK 
00172         (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside) 
00173         tcptest.assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00174 
00175         print tcpfinack 
00176 
00177     #
00178     #Receiving FIN
00179     #
00180         #test if FIN was sent in the same segment
00181         if (tcpfinack.fin == None or tcpfinack.fin == 0):
00182             
00183          #TODO same attribute used (ipfinack, tcpfinack)
00184             (ipfinack, tcpfinack) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, self.thatside)
00185                                   
00186             tcptest.assertSequenceAcknowledgmentOK(self, self.tcb, tcpfinack, \
00187                     self.thisside, self.thatside)
00188         
00189         tcptest.assertFin(self, tcpfinack)
00190 
00191         print tcpfinack 
00192         
00193         #Fin consumes a sequence
00194         self.tcb.tcpsequence[ self.thatside ] += 1
00195              
00196     #
00197     #Sending ACK
00198     #
00199 
00200         #THISSIDE
00201         (ipackfin, tcpackfin) = tcptest.createip(self, self.tcb, self.thisside,
00202                                self.thatside)
00203         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipackfin, tcpackfin, \
00204                 self.thisside, self.thatside)
00205         print tcpackfin 
00206 
00207         #THATHSIDE
00208         #Receiving SYN (receiving from the same board) 
00209         (ipackfinreceived, tcpackfinreceived) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, \
00210                     self.thatside, self.thisside) 
00211                                   
00212         #Different values then 0 and 1 to tcpflags TODO
00213         #self.assertEqual(ipackfin, ipackfinreceived)
00214         #self.assertEqual(tcpackfin, tcpackfinreceived)
00215 
00216 if __name__ == '__main__':
00217     unittest.main()
